jessica dai | cs @ brown

Hi, I'm Jessica!

I'm a sophomore at Brown University studying computer science, with a concentration in artificial intelligence/machine learning; I'm especially interested by technical approaches to algorithmic fairness and interpretable AI.

I care a lot about the potential applications of tech; I was a core team member for the first year of The Impact Summit, a conference for technical students with a passion for social impact, and am on the executive board of CS for Social Change at Brown. I'm particularly interested in the ways that technology can transform how underserved communities interact with the legal system, education, and public services.

I spent this past summer on the engineering team at eNotes.com, and did some work with mobile money transfer platforms with the Change/ICTD Lab at the University of Washington.

Always looking for reading and/or coffee recs!
